channel.title: Which Auxy instruments do you like most?

item.title: Which Auxy instruments do you like most?
item.dc:creator: GioMakyo
item.description:
Ambi has been incredibly useful, I often use it in the background on tracks, and as someone who used to play guitar, if you use a bit of pitch band on it, it sounds remarkably convincing.

Blanket has been my go to pad for a while now.

I must use atom and/or fragment in about half of what I make.

Read full topic

item.source: Which Auxy instruments do you like most?

item.title: Which Auxy instruments do you like most?
item.dc:creator: GioMakyo
item.description:
Atom is a real workhorse, I could use a whole pack with shape & tonecontrols like this, just basic envelope and resonance. I use it all the time. Love Silo, but it really stands out, easy to spot, have to be careful of overuse! But it is a pain in the ass to draw in square waves in volume automation to get the tremolo effect! …(…like Silo…)

Silk & Runner, I use one of those is in almost every track I do in one way or another. Doodle also gets a lot of usage, it’s got a nice thick sound for short clipped sounds, unlike all the other plucks. Fragment is one that is often overlooked, it can be used in so many ways, and if you have it as a lead, it gets really sick when you start to push the tone control up!

Read full topic
